content: [2025, Age 22] Back in NYC, the skyline feels different now. Japan taught me that technology can be both a bridge and a barrier in human connections. Balancing AI-assisted coding with real-world relationships is the new art form. Each line of code now carries a bit more weight, knowing it shapes not just systems, but our social fabric too.
AI coding assistants are like those friends who are always a step ahead, showing you the way. The real skill now is knowing when to take their advice and when to go solo.

[TextBlock(text="Realized today that AI assistants, while accelerating development, sometimes miss the nuances of context. Had to refactor a module manually to capture the intended user flow. It's a reminder that understanding the 'why' behind the code is as crucial as the code itself.", type='text')]
